text:
Q: Firebase OnSnapshot Costs A:

You shouldn't listen to two million documents, period.

Aside from that, it all depends on what your code actually does. Can you give a code snippet that shows the use-case?

Q: Unable to resolve TNS Names using Instant Client 23 under asp.net (only) A:

I switched to the 19c thick client, and after adding the appropriate sqlnet and ldap files, and setting ORACLE_HOME (all of which I did for the instant client), everything worked.

Q: Is there a neater way of passing this string content? A:

Since this looks like json, you might prefer to define an object type for it, then you can serialize it into a string, e.g.

Private Class SearchQuery
    Public ReadOnly Property query As String

    Public Sub New(ByVal query As String)
        Me.query = query
    End Sub
End Class

'...

Dim custID = "P12345"
Dim queryObject = New SearchQuery(custID)
Dim queryString = JsonConvert.SerializeObject(queryObject)

Using queryContent = New StringContent(queryString, Encoding.UTF8, "application/json")
    '... Send the content in a request, noting that the response is probably Disposable too
End Using

There is some built-in support in Visual Studio to create class definitions from json text, if you have more complex json.

Q: Firestore collection -> doc -> collection returning empty list in flutter A:

Most likely your database doesn't have any documents in the profiles collection. That is a totally valid state for the system to be in, and in fact there needs to be no document in the default collection for the first snippet to be able to read incomeRecords from under it.

You can recognize this situation, because the Firestore console will show placeholder document IDs in the profiles collection which are shown in italics, like the common document here:

Such placeholders are just shown in the console so that you can get to the documents under them, but there actually is no document for the placeholder - so they won't be returned in API calls.

When you select an italic placeholder document ID, there should be a message to that effect in the bottom right of the console explaining that too, like in the screenshot below where I selected the fakeid@company.com document:

If you want to be able to read the user profiles, you'll need to make sure that actual documents exist in that collection. It's OK for the document to have no data, but you must create it with a call to add on the profiles collection reference or set on the DocumentReference in there.

To backfill the existing, missing profile documents, you can use a collection group query on incomeRecords, loop through those results, and write the parent document with something like document.ref.parent.parent.set({ dummy: true }).

This is a very common source of confusion for developers, so I recommend also checking out:

  • Setting document via subpaths in firebase causes them to show up as italic?
  • Doc inside the collection appears in italic font while saving into firebase
  • How to get data from first collection in Firestore (and the links there)
  • Why are non auto-generated document Ids are in italics in Firestore console?
  • Firestore document/subcollection is not existing
  • Firestore query returns no documents even though they are shown in the console in italics
